methods.name: addColumn()
methods.desc: Adds a new column to a table

methods.name: removeColumn()
methods.desc: Removes a column from a table

methods.name: getColumnCount()
methods.desc: Gets the number of columns in a table

methods.name: getRowCount()
methods.desc: Gets the number of rows in a table

methods.name: clearRows()
methods.desc: Removes all rows from a table

methods.name: addRow()
methods.desc: Adds a row to a table

methods.name: removeRow()
methods.desc: Removes a row from a table

methods.name: getRow()
methods.desc: Gets a row from a table

methods.name: rows()
methods.desc: Gets multiple rows from a table

methods.name: getInt()
methods.desc: Get an integer value from the specified row and column

methods.name: setInt()
methods.desc: Store an integer value in the specified row and column

methods.name: getFloat()
methods.desc: Get a float value from the specified row and column

methods.name: setFloat()
methods.desc: Store a float value in the specified row and column

methods.name: getString()
methods.desc: Get an String value from the specified row and column

methods.name: setString()
methods.desc: Store a String value in the specified row and column

methods.name: getStringColumn()
methods.desc: Gets all values in the specified column

methods.name: findRow()
methods.desc: Finds a row that contains the given value

methods.name: findRows()
methods.desc: Finds multiple rows that contain the given value

methods.name: matchRow()
methods.desc: Finds a row that matches the given expression

methods.name: matchRows()
methods.desc: Finds multiple rows that match the given expression

methods.name: matchRowIterator()
methods.desc: Finds multiple rows that match the given expression

methods.name: removeTokens()
methods.desc: Removes characters from the table

methods.name: trim()
methods.desc: Trims whitespace from values

methods.name: sort()
methods.desc: Orders a table based on the values in a column

description:
Generic class for handling tabular data, typically from a CSV, TSV, or other sort of spreadsheet file.

CSV files are comma separated values, often with the data in quotes. TSV files use tabs as separators, and usually don't bother with the quotes.

File names should end with .csv if they're comma separated.

A rough "spec" for CSV can be found here.
